message.content:
cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.GT

Reasoning: The problem of reconstructing a string from its substring compositions is a combinatorial problem that involves discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and graph theory (cs.GT). The paper also uses algebraic considerations to characterize the set of strings with the same substring compositions, which falls under computational complexity (cs.CC). The problem can be viewed as a simplification of the turnpike problem, which is a well-known problem in computational geometry (cs.CG) and discrete mathematics. Finally, the paper provides an algorithm for reconstructing random strings in near-quadratic time, which falls under data structures and algorithms (cs.DS).
